#Current Court# have considered the above Report filed by #respondants#.
On 2nd May, 2017, #amicus# had briefed #Current Court# on the above Report filed by #respondants#.
It was pointed out on that day that use of Furnace Oil and Pet-Coke is prohibited in Delhi.
use of Furnace Oil and Pet-Coke is prohibited in Delhi was further stated that These #respondants# had no objection if the ban is placed on the use of Furnace Oil and Pet-Coke.
These #respondants# were, therefore, permitted to place such a ban.
Almost four months have gone by and #Current Court# are told that none of These #respondants# have taken any action in this matter.
To make the situation worse, there is no representation on behalf of the #respondants# nor is there any representation from the State of Rajasthan.
Learned Counsel appearing for the State of Rajasthan wants #Current Court# to wait for two minutes so that Learned Counsel can get instructions from the State Government.
#Current Court# are not inclined to wait for two minutes so as to enable Learned Counsel to get instructions.
Instructions should have been obtained well before the date of hearing.

Since the #respondants# of U.P., Haryana and Rajasthan have no objection and the #respondants# of U.P., Haryana and Rajasthan have not taken any positive action, keeping the pollution level in NCR and particularly in Delhi, #Current Court# have no option but to place a ban on use of Furnace Oil and Pet-Coke in the #respondants#. a ban will come into effect from 1st November, 2017. #Current Court# expect the "#respondants# to issue appropriate notification immediately.
Even if the "#respondants# do not issue such notification then in compliance with the order of this Court, a ban will take effect from 1st November, 2017 in any case.
The issue for #Current Court#'s consideration today is fixing standards for 34 industries with regard to the SO2, NOX and SOX emissions.
On 2nd May, 2017, #Current Court# had directed the #respondants# as well as the #respondants# (#respondants#) to fix the standards for the 34 industries mentioned in the order dated 2nd May, 2017.
#Current Court# had further directed that the standards for the 34 industries mentioned in the order should be fixed on or before 30th June, 2017.
#Current Court# # had given opportunity to the #respondants# and the #respondants# to move an application for reasonable extension of time.

#Current Court# # had also cautioned the above industries, as submitted by #amicus#, and agreed to by the learned Additional Solicitor General, that necessary steps would have to be taken by the above industries to ensure that the pollution standards that are fixed by the #respondants# are adhered to by 31.12.2017 as far as possible.
the above industries should, therefore, start making the above industries plans with immediate effect since sufficient notice is being given to the above industries in this regard.
The matter was again taken up by #Current Court# on 20th July, 2017.

On that date, #Current Court# had noted the submissions of the learned Additional Solicitor General that some more time is required to fix the standards of NOX and SOX and perhaps some other emissions and effluents.
the learned Additional Solicitor General had stated that the learned Additional Solicitor General will file an affidavit during the course of the day.

Several applications were also listed before #Current Court# on the day and #advocate_appellant#(s) had stated that Several applications did not press Several applications since Several applications have instructions to assure this Court that the industry would abide by whatever standards are fixed by the #respondants# by 31st December, 2017.
The assurance was taken on record.

Today, learned the learned Additional Solicitor General has brought to #Current Court#'s notice that an affidavit was in fact filed by the learned Additional Solicitor General on behalf of the#respondants#on 20th July, 2017.
In an affidavit, it was stated that insofar as 9 industries are concerned, SO2, NOX and SOX standards had already been fixed.
This is confirmed by #amicus#.

This is also brought to #Current Court#'s notice that emission standards for SO2, NOX and SOX are not required to be fixed in respect of two industries, viz., electroplating industries and stone crushing units since there is no emission of SO2, NOX and SOX.

#Current Court# have been told by learned Counsel appearing on behalf of the #respondants# that draft standards were fixed by the #respondants# in respect of 16 industries and these were communicated to the#respondants#on 27.06.2017.
#Current Court# are told by #advocate_respondant# that in respect of these 16 industries, the standards were communicated to the#respondants#on 27.06.2017.
#Current Court# are told by the learned Additional Solicitor General the learned Additional Solicitor General that with regard to 5 more industries, the standards were sent subsequently.

#Current Court# are quite distressed that the#respondants#the#respondants#has been sitting over 16 recommendations at least since 27.06.2017, that is, almost about three months without apparently showing any concern whatsoever for the pollution in Delhi and in NCR.

the #advocate_respondant# further informs #Current Court# that the draft notification with regard to these industries was issued on 23rd October, 2017 inviting objections and in terms of Section 5 of the Environment Protection Rules, 60 days' time is required to be given for inviting objections.
This period would expire on or about 23rd December, 2017 when hopefully notifications would be issued.

In any event, since the draft notifications have been issued and since the industry had assured #Current Court# on 20.07.2017 that the industry had assured #Current Court# on 20.07.2017 that they would abide by the standards fixed by the #respondants#, #Current Court# would abide by the standards fixed by the #respondants#, #Current Court# expect the industries to live up to the assurance given to #Current Court# by the industry even though the Ministry" of Environment, Forest and Climate Change does not seem to be concerned about the entire issue.

With regard to two remaining industries, that is,, nitric acid industry and fertilizer industry, #Current Court# are told that the standards in this regard were sent to the#respondants#by the #respondants# on 14th February, 2014.
Three and half years have gone by, but the#respondants#the#respondants#has not done anything about it.
This is a completely disgusting state of affairs and This is hardly the way in which the Ministry ought to function if it is expected to perform it duties sincerely, honestly and with dedication.

#advocate_respondant# informs #Current Court# that necessary steps will be taken (after a lapse of three and half years) to issue a draft notification and needful will be done within one month from today, meaning thereby, the deadline of 31st December, 2017 will be crossed by the MoE.

#Current Court# record #Current Court#'s unhappiness at the attitude of the MoE, but #Current Court# expect the industry to abide by the assurance that has already been given to #Current Court# and particularly since #Current Court#'s unhappiness at the attitude of the MoE, but #Current Court# are aware of the standards proposed by the #respondants#, maybe for the last couple of years at least.

#Current Court# make it clear that the#respondants#the#respondants#is bound by the statement made by Learned Additional Solicitor General that the draft notification for the two industries would be issued within one month from today.

Seeing the totally insensitive attitude of the Ministry, #Current Court# are inclined and #Current Court# do impose costs of ` 2,00,000/- (Rupees two lakhs only) on the#respondants#the#respondants#so that at least they now wake up to the problem relating to environment.
The amount be deposited in the Supreme Court Legal Services Committee within four weeks from today for utilization of juvenile justice issues.
List the Report No. 72 on 11th December, 2017.
Liberty is granted to the #respondants# to file additional affidavit.

Issue notice.

List the application on 16th November, 2017 with other connected applications.

In the meanwhile, #advocate_appellant# has placed before #Current Court# a letter dated 12th October, 2017 which has been issued by the State of Haryana through the office of the Executive Engineer, HUDA, Division No. 1 Gurugram pursuant to the minutes of the meeting held on 8th September, 2017.

As pertain to different subject matters. A copy of this direction be communicated to the Secretary General of the Registry for compliance.
